question: A and B can do a piece of work in 36 days, B and C can do a it in 60 days, A and C can do it in 45 days. C alone can do it in :
explanation:
(A + B)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{36}&s=1$
(B + C)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{60}&s=1$
(C + A)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{45}&s=1$
On adding, 
2(A + B + C)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{36}+\\frac{1}{60}+\\frac{1}{45} = \\frac{5+3+4}{180} = \\frac{1}{15}&s=1$
∴ (A + B + C)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{30}&s=1$
∴ c\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{30}-\\frac{1}{36} = \\frac{6-5}{180} = \\frac{1}{180}&s=1$
∴ C alone will complete the work in 180 days. 
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
